ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function

Class Circuit

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.dag.Node
      • ca.uqac.lif.dag.NestedNode
        • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.Circuit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectable, Contextualizable, ExplanationQueryable, Function, Queryable, Duplicable

    public class Circuit
extends NestedNode
implements Function, Duplicable, ExplanationQueryable
    An object encasing a graph of connected functions and acting externally as a single function.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

      • getExplanation

        public PartNode getExplanation(Part part,
                               NodeFactory factory)
        Description copied from interface: ExplanationQueryable
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part, using nodes provided by a given factory.
        Specified by:
        getExplanation in interface ExplanationQueryable
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        factory - The factory that provides nodes
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.

      • develop

        protected NestedNode develop(Part start,
                             Node subject,
                             NodeFactory factory)
        From an output pin of an inner function, calculates the explanation and repeats the process if any input pins that are mentioned are connected to output pins of other functions. This has for effect of generating the explanation graph of the whole circuit.

        The method encapsulates this graph into a nested node. This node has a single input pin (the output used as the starting point) and has as many output pins as the number of leaves in the resulting graph. Each of these pins is linked to the input pin of one of the functions in the circuit that are associated to an input pin of the circuit itself.

        Parameters:
        start - The output part to explain, used as a starting point
        subject - The inner function that must provide the explanation
        factory - A factory used to obtain part nodes. This factory must be distinct from the one given to the circuit in a call to getExplanation(Part, NodeFactory)
        Returns:
        The nested node containing the explanation graph of the entire circuit.

      • getPin

        protected static Pin<? extends Node> getPin(java.util.Collection<Pin<? extends Node>> pins)
        Extracts the first pin obtained from a collection. The main purpose of this method is to obtain the only element of a collection which we know is a singleton.
        Parameters:
        pins - The collection of pins
        Returns:
        The pin

      • getExplanation

        public PartNode getExplanation(Part part)
        Description copied from interface: ExplanationQueryable
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part. The method creates a new node factory by itself.
        Specified by:
        getExplanation in interface ExplanationQueryable
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.
